content: 1 just mosaic it by susan ashcroft yarn you can use any weight fingering to worsted you can even combine 2 different weights e g fingering and sport or sport and dk if you are using 2 different weights generally it will work best if the lighter weight yarn is cc be sure that your mc contrasts with all the colours in the cc yardage allow at least 200m/220 yds of each of 2 yarns for a topline of approx 150cm/60 rowan baby alpaca dk and zitron trekking hand art flame for a larger item more like a shawl simply on 4 5mm / us 7 approx 200m/220yds of each allow more yardage gauge is not critical just be sure you like the you can find more yarn ideas and projects linked to fabric you are getting the pattern page on ravelry https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/just- if you re not sure start a 2nd piece separately mosaic-it so you have the two to compare and then continue with the one that s working best link for cable cast-on http //stitchnerd blogspot be/2011/10/cable- blocking to form a boomerang shape cast-on html you probably only need 3 pins one in each corner abbreviations if the piece is rolling it can work well to block it with the rs facing down to counteract the rolling mc/cc main colour/contrast colour st s = stitch es k = knit p = purl rs/ws = right side/wrong side k2tog = knit 2 sts together kfb = knit into the front and back loops pfb = purl into the front and back loops sl pw = slip purlwise wyif = with yarn in front wyib = with yarn in back all stitches are slipped purlwise with the yarn on the ws of the fabric wyib on rs wyif on ws © ashcroft-hempsall 2022 - for personal non-commercial use only 2 getting started cast on 8 sts with mc using cable cast-on so you get no bumps on the rs then work row 1 of chart 1 using the cc chart 1 you will only work with one yarn for each pair of row changing yarns at the start of every rs row picking up the new yarn from underneath note that the chart only shows the rs row on the ws work as follows mc slip all cc sts wyif as you come to them work mc sts as follows slip the 1st stitch wyif then purl all mc stitches to the last 2 sts pfb sl1 wyif cc slip all mc sts wyif as you come to them work cc sts as follows slip the 1st stitch wyif then knit all cc stitches to the last 2 sts kfb sl1 wyif note that on row 33 you slip 2 sts after the kfb at the start of the row to keep the motifs as symmetrical as possible © ashcroft-hempsall 2022 -
